Course Name: INTRODUCTION TO EARLY CHILDHOOD SERVICES
Description:
Orientation to the field of early childhood education: historical and present day programs and services for young
 children 0-8.

Course Name: UNDERSTANDING YOUNG CHILDREN:TYPICAL AND ATYPICAL PATHWAYS
Corequesites: ECED 30134 and 30164 and 40145.Pre or Corequisite: SPED 23000; and admission to advanced study.
Description:
Growth and development of young children from birth to age eight as it occurs along both typical and atypical
 pathways.

Course Name: LANGUAGE AND LITERACY FOR THE PRESCHOOL CHILD
Corequesites: ECED 30142 and ECED30147 and ECED 40165 and ECED 40192 (ECED Block II).
Description:
(Equivalent to ECET 22130) An examination of the process of language and
literacy development in preschool
 children. The course focuses on how preschool teachers integrate knowledge of development with early school
and family literacy learning.

Course Name: INTEGRATED EXPRESSIVE ARTS AND SOCIAL STUDIES IN PRESCHOOL
Corequesites: ECED 20163 and ECED 30164 and ECED 40145 (ECED Block I).
Description:
Young children's development in the expressive arts and social studies; implications for development of the
 environment, integrated curriculum and teaching methods for preschool children.

Course Name: PARTNERSHIPS AND GUIDANCE FOR PRESCHOOL CHILDREN
Corequesites: ECED 30123 and ECED 30147 and ECED 40165 and ECED 40192(ECED Block II).
Description:
(Equivalent to ECET 21005) Appropriate guidance strategies set the foundation for positive experiences our
 youngest children in school; patterns learned early often set a foundation for primary school entry. This course
 addresses the concerns of guidance family partnerships and inclusive schooling with preschool children and their
 educators. It takes a proactive stance, helping teachers develop a constructive guidance approach.

Course Name: INTEGRATED CURRICULUM FOR SOCIAL STUDIES
Prerequisites: ECED 30134 and admission to advanced study.
Corequesites: ECED40142 and ECED 40105 and ECED 40107 and ECED 40123.
Description:
Objectives, resources, curriculum development, methods of teaching social studies and expressive arts at
 kindergarten and primary levels; emphasis on developing integrated social studies curriculum; infusing multiple
 forms of expressive arts into integrated curriculum and assessment; and engaging professional collaboration
 with teachers in the
field.

Course Name: EARLY EXPERIENCES IN MATHEMATICS AND SCIENCE
Prerequisites: C (2.000) or better in MATH 14001 and14002 and admission to advanced study.
Corequesites:
ECED30123 and ECED 30142 and ECED 40165 and
 ECED 40192.
Description:
Instructional psychology and materials for effective teaching of mathematics and science in preschool settings
 with a theoretical emphasis on cognitive development.

Course Name: PRESCHOOL EDUCATION
Corequesites: ECED 20163 and ECED 30134 and ECED 40145 (ECED Block I).
Description:
Integrated curriculum utilizing principles of developmentally appropriate practice in settings for children under
 five. Field experience two mornings a week. Students are required to complete Bureau
of Criminal Investigation
 and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to
 authorized personnel at their assigned school or agency before the first
day of the semester.

Course Name: INTEGRATED FIELD EXPERIENCES
Corequesites:
ECED40114 and
ECED 40126 and ECED 40127 and ECED 40147.
Description:
Participation in experiences offering opportunity to plan and teach reading, language arts, integrated content
 units and observe students in
early childhood classrooms. Students are required to complete Bureau of
Criminal
 Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit
 the results to authorized personnel at their assigned schoolagency before the first day
of the semester in which
 student teaching internship will take place.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 50093 and ECED 70093) Topics of special interest to students
 desiring to intensify their knowledge in particular areas. Presenters include Kent early childhood faculty
 members and may include experts from outside agencies and other institutions. S u/graded.

Course Name: APPROPRIATE PHONICS INSTRUCTION FOR KINDERGARTEN AND PRIMARY CHILDREN
Prerequisites: ECED 30123 and admission to advanced study.
Corequesites:
ECED 30144 ECED 40107 and ECED40123 and ECED 40142 (Block
III).
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 50105) An examination of phonics in early reading and writing development, effective
 strategies for teaching and assessing phonics appropriate for kindergarten and primary grade children.

Course Name: TEACHING MATHEMATICS: EARLY YEARS I
Prerequisites: ECED 30147 and MATH 14001 and 14002 and admission toadvanced study.
Corequesites: ECED 30144 and ECED 40105 andECED 40123 and ECED 40142.
Description:
Instructional psychology and materials for effective teaching of mathematics in grades K-1 with a theoretical
 emphasis on cognitive development.

Course Name: TEACHING SCIENCE IN THE EARLY YEARS
Prerequisites: ECED 30147 and admission to advanced study.
Corequesites: ECED 40126 and ECED 40127and ECED 40092 and ECED 40147 (Block IV).
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 50114) This course investigates engaging young children in inquiry-based processes of
 science. Emphasis is given to creating developmentally appropriate experiences in accordance to NAEYC
guidelines. National and state science standards as well as the college and graduate school of education
 conceptual framework. Attention is focused on the use of science materials safety planning assessment and
incorporating science across the curriculum.

Course Name: CRITICAL INQUIRY INTO INTERATED CURRICULUM IN THE PRIMARY YEARS
Corequesites: ECED 30144 and ECED 40105 and ECED 40107 and ECED 40142.
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 50123) Theoretical and content background addressing integration of curriculum and
 global perspectives aligned with the International Baccalaureate Primary Years Programme.

Course Name: INQUIRY INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE
Description:
Interdisciplinary inquiry into teaching as a professional practice in ECED; emphasis on teacher as researcher.
 Utilization of teaching learning technologies.

Course Name: DEVELOPMENTAL READING AND WRITING:EARLY YEARS
Prerequisites: ECED 40105 and admission to advanced study.
Corequesites: ECED 40114 and ECED40127 and ECED 40092 and ECED 40147.
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 50126) This course builds on work begun in 40105. It explores how teachers support
 primary children's literacy development through small group strategic instruction based on formative
 assessments.

Course Name: DEVELOPING A BALANCED LITERACY PROGRAM
Corequesites: ECED 40114 and ECED 40126 and ECED 40092 and ECED 40147.
Description:
This course expands on the previous three literacy courses to explore how research-based instruction requires a
 balance of literacy learning formats; an integration with learning in the content areas and is based on
 assessment of individual children's reading and writing abilities.

Course Name: HOME-SCHOOL-COMMUNITY-PARTNERSHIPS IN DIVERSE CONTEXTS
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 50142) Approaches to parent and community involvement in the education and welfare
 of children are examined, applied, and discussed. Focuses are theories, policies, practices, skills, and
 knowledges of partnership building in educational settings. An emphasis on differentiation of practices for
 diverse communities is applied to teaching and learning in the primary grades.

Course Name: MUSIC AND RHYTHMS IN PRE-PRIMARY EDUCATION
Corequesites: ECED 20163 and ECED 30134 and ECED 30164 (ECED Block I).
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 50145) Music and rhythms for preprimary children. Optional course intended for majors
 in early childhood education or other persons desiring additional work with preprimary children.

Course Name: TEACHING MATHEMATICS:EARLY YEARS II
Prerequisites: C or better in MATH 14001 and 14002 and admission toadvanced study.
Description:
Instructional psychology and materials for effective teaching of mathematics in grades K-3 with a theoretical
 emphasis on cognitive development.

Course Name: GUIDANCE OF YOUNG CHILDREN
Description:
Principles and practices of appropriate guidance for young children, intervention strategies, resources and
 materials for guidance.

Course Name: INTEGRATED APPLICATION OF PRESCHOOL CURRICULUM
Corequesites: ECED 30123 and ECED 30142 and ECED 30147 and ECED.
Description:
(Equivalent to ECET 22140) Internship in preschool. Advanced integrated preschool curriculum utilizing
 principles of developmentally appropriate
practice focusing on infant toddler and preschool age children.
Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau
 of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned
 school-agency before the first day of the semester in which student teaching internship will take place.

Course Name: INTERNSHIP IN PRESCHOOL
Prerequisites:
ECED30164 and admission to advanced study; and Official valid certification of Child Safety Training, approved Basic
 Life Support and A.L.I.C.E. Training must be presented to
the campus office of clinical experience or designated
 faculty/staff at
Regional campuses as prerequisite for student teaching.
Corequesites: ECED 30123 and ECED30142 and ECED 30147 and ECED 40165
Description: (Equivalent to ECET 22150) Internship in preschool settings, full day for fifteen weeks.

Course Name: INDIVIDUAL INVESTIGATION IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Prerequisites: Admission to advanced study and special approval.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Open to seniors in ECED. Intensive individual study on an early childhood topic selected
 by student and adviser.

Course Name: INTERNSHIP IN KINDERGARTEN/PRIMARY
Prerequisites:
admission to advanced study;and Official valid certification of Child Safety Training, approved Basic Life Support and A.L.I.C.E. Training must
 be presented to the campus office of clinical experience or designated faculty/staff at Regional campuses as
 prerequisite for student teaching.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Internship in grades K-3, full day for 15 weeks.
Students are required to complete
 Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background
 checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned school-agency before the first day of
 the semester in which student teaching internship will take place.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 40093 and ECED 70093) Variable topic workshop in early
 childhood education.

Course Name: APPROPRIATE PHONICS INSTRUCTION FOR KINDERGARTEN AND PRIMARY CHILDREN
Prerequisites: graduate standing;and early childhood education (ECDE) major; and ECED 60167.
Description:
An examination of phonics in early reading and writing development, effective strategies for teaching and
 assessing phonics appropriate for kindergarten and primary grade children.

Course Name: TEACHING SCIENCE IN THE EARLY YEARS
Prerequisites: Graduate standing in the Master of Arts in Teaching(MAT) program.
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 40114) This course investigates engaging young children in inquiry-based processes of
 science. Emphasis is given to creating developmentally appropriate experiences in accordance to NAEYC
guidelines. National and state science standards as well as the college and graduate school of education
 conceptual framework. Attention is focused on the use of science materials safety planning assessment and
incorporating science across the curriculum.

Course Name: CRITICAL INQUIRY INTO INTEGRATED CURRICULUM IN THE PRIMARY YEARS
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 40123) Theoretical and content background addressing integration of curriculum and
 global perspectives aligned with the International Baccalaureate Primary Years Programme.

Course Name: INQUIRY INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE
Prerequisites: admission to advanced study and graduate standing.
Description:
Interdisciplinary inquiry into teaching as a professional practice in ECED; emphasis on teacher as researcher.
 Utilization of teaching learning technologies.

Course Name: DEVELOPMENTAL READING AND WRITING: THE EARLY YEARS
Prerequisites: admission to the ECED MAT program.
Description:
Taken in conjunction with ECED 50105 in the MAT program. It explores how
teachers support primary children's
 literacy development through small and whole group strategic instruction based on formative assessments.

Course Name: HOME, SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY RELATIONS
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 40142) Approaches to parent and community involvement in the education and welfare
 of children. Understanding of role of community agencies and organizations.

Course Name: MUSIC AND RHYTHMS IN PREPRIMARY EDUCATION
Prerequisites: Special approval from instructor. Graduate standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 40145) Comprehensive coverage of music and rhythms for preprimary child. Intended
 for early childhood education majors or other persons desiring additional work in music with preprimary
 children.

Course Name: TEACHING MATHEMATICS:EARLY YEARS
Description:
Instructional psychology and materials for effective teaching of mathematics in prekindergarten through grade
 three with a theoretical emphasis on cognitive development.

Course Name: ORGANIZATION AND SUPERVISION OF EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTERS
Description:
Basic guidelines for establishing and supervising early childhood settings for infants,preschool and school age
 children.

Course Name: CONSTRUCTIVIST TEACHING IN EARLY CHILDHOOD CLASSROOMS
Description:
Theorists and researchers with a constructivist orientation will be examined in relationship to teacher beliefs.
 The course will focus on constructivist practices emphasizing child sensitive curriculum and teaching practices.

Course Name: DEVELOPING A BALANCED LITERACY PROGRAM
Description:
An examination of own teaching practice focusing on assessment strategies to inform decision making for
 individual children and evaluation strategies to fine tune a balanced literacy program.

Course Name: TEACHING HUMANITIES: EARLY YEARS
Prerequisites: admission to advanced study and graduate standing.
Description:
Looking at Humanities through the lens of a young child’s experience in learning with a focus on visual thinking
 and expression, music and movement.

Course Name: HUMANITIES FOR CHILDREN
Description: (Cross-listed with ECED 70112) Relevance of humanities as applied to education of young children.

Course Name: PRESCHOOL EDUCATION
Description: (Cross-listed with ECED 70113) In-depth study of curriculum development in preschool programs.

Course Name: TEACHING SOCIAL STUDIES: EARLY YEARS
Description:
Involves the systematic study of the theories, methods, and materials necessary to successfully teach social
 studies to diverse populations of
pre-Kindergarten and elementary school students growing up in a global
society. The course will consider aspects of the history of social studies and theory and research in social
 education as a background for understanding methods and materials.

Course Name: SOCIOMORAL ENVIRONMENT IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 70151) Children's social and moral development will be explored in relationship to the
 context of primary classrooms. Children's social problem-solving, friendship making, guidance strategies and
 interventions, building and facilitating classroom communities and promoting caring classrooms will be the focus
 of this course.

Course Name: APPLICATION OF SELECTED THEORETICAL PRINCIPLES TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF
Description:
YOUNG CHILDREN
(Cross-listed with ECED 70152) Examination of theories pertaining to child development which have special
 relevance in understanding and meeting developmental needs of young children. Application of selected
theoretical principles to child development.

Course Name: RECONCEPTUALIZING EARLY CHILDHOOD CURRICULUM
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 70158) Course examines postmodern understanding of early childhood education
 curricula in relationship to teaching (instruction-oriented teaching vs. pedagogy-based teaching). Social,
historical, legal, political, international and cultural issues that have affected early childhood education curricula
 practices will be critically examined.

Course Name: TYPICAL AND ATYPICAL DEVELOPMENT IN YOUNG CHILDREN
Description:
(Cross-listed with SPED 63955) Overview of typical/atypical development pathways age three to grade three:
 theories of behavior, implications of
atypical development on play/learning; development within ecological
framework.

Course Name: LANGUAGE AND LITERACY:UNDERSTANDING DEVELOPMENT
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 70167) The development of language in children from birth through age eight with a
 focus on the process of typical language development and the diversity of multi-cultural language. Topics
 specifically related to classroom teaching include the assessment
of language delays and disorders and
 strategies for connecting oral language to literacy in preschool.

Course Name: THESIS I
Description:
Thesis students must register for a total of 6 hours, 2 to 6 hours in a single semester distributed over several
 semesters if desired.

Course Name: THESIS II
Description: Thesis students must continue registration each semester until all degree requirements are met.

Course Name: SEMINAR IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 77291) Seminar in early childhood education.

Course Name: PRACTICUM AND INTERNSHIP IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Prerequisites:
Graduate standing; and Official valid certification of Child Safety Training, approved Basic LifeSupport and A.L.I.C.E. Training must be presented to the campus office of clinical experience or designated
 faculty/staff at Regional campuses as prerequisite for student teaching.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 77292) Practicum/internship in early childhood education.
 Students are required
to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau
 of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned
 school/agency before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

Course Name: SPECIAL TOPICS IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 77295) Special topics in
early childhood education.

Course Name: INDIVIDUAL INVESTIGATION IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Individual investigation in early childhood education.

Course Name: RESEARCH IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Research in early childhood education.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 40093 and ECED 50093)

Course Name: CONSTRUCTIVIST TEACHING IN EARLY CHILDHOOD CLASSROOMS
Description:
Theorists and researchers with a constructivist orientation will be examined in relationship to teacher beliefs.
 The course will focus on constructivist practices emphasizing child-sensitive curriculum and teaching practices.

Course Name: DEVELOPING A BALANCED LITERACY PROGRAM
Description:
An examination of own teaching practice focusing on assessment strategies to inform decision-making for
 individual children and evaluation strategies to fine tune a balanced literacy program.

Course Name: PRESCHOOL EDUCATION
Description: (Cross-listed with ECED 60113) In-depth study of curriculum development in preschool programs.

Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 60151) Children's social and moral development will be explored in relationship to the
 context of primary classrooms. Children's social problem-solving, friendship- making, guidance strategies and
 interventions, building and facilitating classroom communities and promoting caring classrooms will be the focus
 of this course.

Description:
YOUNG CHILDREN
(Cross-listed with ECED 60152) Examination of theories pertaining to child development which have special
 relevance in understanding and meeting developmental needs of young children. Application of selected
theoretical principles to child development.

Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 60158) Course examines postmodern understanding of early childhood education

 practices will be critically examined.

Course Name: SEMINAR IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 67291) Seminar in ECED.

Course Name: PRACTICUM AND INTERNSHIP IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description:
(Cross-listed with ECED 67292) Practicum/internship in ECED. Students are required to complete Bureau of

Course Name: SPECIAL TOPICS IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ECED 67295) Special topics in
ECED.

Course Name: ADVANCED SEMINAR IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Advanced seminar in ECED.

Course Name: SPECIAL TOPICS IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Special topics in ECED.

Course Name: RESEARCH IN EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Research in ECED.
